name: Ramada Bangor

reviews.text: Well, where do i start. After 10 hours of driving i decided it was time to find a hotel. So we came across Ramada first. We figured its a big chain it should be a great place. Boy were we wrong. I checked in with my wife and 3 kids. It was over $120 for one room! I was surprised i figured they would have a cheaper rate in the winter. They told us they had a indoor pool and a nice fitness room. which were great incentives to staying. It was late so we went to our room. The doors to get into the building were so heavy! I'm a big guy and i had a hard time with them. I can't imagine a woman having to open them. We walked in and immediately noticed the stains on the hallway carpet. it looked like water damage and it took on a big portion of the hall. and where there is water damage there is usually mold. i didn't want my children walking on that! I took my family to the room. it was late so we just went straight to bed. Our sleep was interrupted several times by loud people in the hall and the guests that were staying in the rooms next to us. We could hear everything! The walls were so thin! i won't go into detail the things that were said but let me just say it was nothing i wanted my children to hear! My wife who is allergic to dogs and cigarette smoke. was coughing all night. i could tell it was from one or the other. But we got a non smoking room on the first floor where there is suppose to be no smoking rooms so how could this be right? wrong. turns out this is a pet friendly hotel too. so they let whatever in where ever not considering that people with allergies will be in that room next. After a ruff nights sleep. We went down front looking for the continental breakfast. but there was none just a over priced restaurant on site. So we went there and ordered some food. My wife found a hair in her omellette! i'm not just saying this because i found this hotel to be disgusting. it is true! it really happen. At this point i had enough of this place but the kids really wanted to go swimming. So we went in and checked the pool out. We went swimming. There was so much chlorine in that pool it made my skin feel so dry even in the water! the floor around the pool is really uncomfortable to walk on in bare feet it consists of these rock pebbles. There is no hot tub either. Also the fitness room that we were told about amounted to 4 rundown treadmills. thats it! no weights! hard floor space and worst of all no air! it was so hot inside. The wireless internet was a joke. They offer one computer on site and it was slower then dial-up! and half the sites wouldn't load. In conclusion, I would just like to say that Ramada Inn does not accommodate there guests. Everything they say they have is a joke. I would find it hard to believe that anyone would be happy staying there. I would have rather slept in the car.
reviews.title: The Worst Hotel Experience I've ever had!

likes.disliked: — the noise, the mold, the lack of sleep, the resturant.

reviews.text: This hotel has lost control of it's "quiet time". The Bar/Restaurant seems to lend to all night action, loud people, loud vehicles, squealing tires, the odd airplane landing in the middle of the night and very poor sound deadening walls make it impossible to get any sleep. There seemed to be no attempt to control noise. Rooms were clean and roomy but hallways wreaked of cigarette smoke.
reviews.title: Noisest Hotel Ever

reviews.text: Must agree with TravellingGirl1980. During our stay at this property we were sickened by the smoke visibly pouring into the room through the bathroom vents. Keep in mind this was a non-smoking room. A complaint to the front desk brought a shrug and half-hearted apology suggesting this is a complaint they've heard a lot -- and chosen to disregard. Couple this with the tired furnishings, this hotel certainly takes the prize for most overpriced, most unsatisfactory stay I've experienced in some time. Avoid.
reviews.title: Substandard

reviews.text: I have tried many of the hotels in Bangor, including all of the hotels on Odlin Road, yet I have avoided the Ramada Bangor in the past simply due to its notorious nightlife and active pool area. It seems as if the hotel's popularity is also a deterrent for people such as myself, especially if one is seeking a quite overnight to catch an early morning flight or a quite place to take a family without the headache of those late night hallway wanders. On this trip, the price was right so I checked into the hotel in early October as an overnight spot on my way to Florida. I must mention that I stayed on a Thursday night so there was little activity at the nightclub. Check-in was quick with a friendly desk staff. The room was surprisingly clean… I say this since I expected that the party goers may have damaged the rooms, but this was not the case. Each room offers clean, comfortable beds. Room amenities include a hair dryer, iron, ironing board. The bathroom is clean. The indoor pool was a little cooler than expected since the hotel states that the pool is “heated”. There is an onsite restaurant (Barnaby's Restaurant) which offers a nice, affordable breakfast. Furthermore, Barnaby’s offers a lounge/bar during the evening which can offer a good spot for those seeking some nightlife or a night-cap… neither of which I can comment on as my traveling party was in bed before 9pm. The hotel offers high-speed wireless internet in room. Within walking distance is both a Tim Hortons and a Dunkin Donuts, for those looking for their favourite coffee. The hotel, like many others on Odlin Road, is only few minutes from the Bangor International Airport. During my stay, the hotel does not offer a “park-n-fly” option however, long term parking at the airport is approx. $60 for a week. Though I won’t say that the Ramada Bangor is trendy with the most recent décor, it will offer a good, clean place to stay in Bangor, Maine.
reviews.title: Clean and Comfort on Odlin Road

reviews.text: We were generally pleased with our room but discovered later that due to our location on the second floor facing the road and apparently over the bar/restaurant that sleeping was not going to be an option.
reviews.title: PARTY CENTRAL ON SATURDAY NIGHTS

reviews.text: I was told in the morning that there had been a well attended concert in the area the night before and many of their guests had continued the party back at the hotel. I see from other reviews that this might actually be a regular thing.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Experience!!

reviews.text: I was treated first to loud talk and laughter, then as the evening became early morning it changed to even louder shouting and profanity. It was then topped off by motorcyles revving their engines for about 15-20 minutes. My companion seemed to be sleeping through the noise so I decided not to get up and call the desk and chance waking her. When I spoke to them in the morning I was given an email address. I have written my concerns but have received no reply/apology.
reviews.title: DON'T STAY HERE

reviews.text: I realize that the partyiers are also paying guests but when you pay $140 to sleep for a few hours you should be able to do just that. If they want to run an entertainment facility there should be a separation or sound proofing or staff who know how to have rowdy guests tune things down after 3 in the morning.
reviews.title: Stay anywhere but here!

reviews.text: Much too noisy when their bar is open Wednesday thru Saturday. Bar patrons do not finish leaving til 1:30AM or later - unable to sleep it is so loud. Housekeeping staff is very good.

reviews.title: needing maid service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Airport hotels can be a bit iffy sometimes in y experience, this one was great. Nice and welcoming staff on reception, free shuttle bus to the airport of if you wanted to go to a nearby restaurant. The free internet access worked, not always the case in every hotel that offers this. The room was not fancy, but clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Perfect for the airport and not awful

reviews.text: After a 7 hour drive - with a car packed full of college gear - my teen and I were anxious to check in and chill out. Check-in was fine, the clerk was able to change my room from a King to 2 doubles (even though I'd booked it on a hot wire site). We drove around to the back corner to our entrance door - really dark parking lot. Made me nervous about leaving my car full of gear there.
reviews.title: Hallways reeked of cigarette smoke!

reviews.text: Went in the door, and the hallways looked old and almost seemed like a faint cigarette smell. Walked up the stairs (couldn't find an elevator) and the second floor absolutely REEKED of cigarette smoke! All the rooms in the area had "non-smoking room" signs on them, so I don't know where that was coming from. Perhaps Barnaby's - the nightclub in the hotel? If so, I couldn't even hear it. It smelled so bad that in just the brief walk to our room, the smell stuck in my hair.
reviews.title: Nice spot for a quick stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was up here for a wedding in Hermon, ME for a weekend. This hotel was close to the reception hall. Rooms were nothing fancy, but suitable, showed a little wear and tear. The hotel definately shows it's age, but I knew that going in. If i needed to stay in Bangor for a reasonable price and just needed a place to sleep, this wouldn't be a bad bet. Like I said, nothing special, but convenient to Bangor.
reviews.title: Convenient To Bangor

reviews.text: This was our annual, extended family, summer trip. We had a total of 8 adults and 3 young children. Having just driven close to twelve hours from NYC, tired and cranky, we were all ready to hit the sack. So, I was not very happy when I saw a hill of ants in the middle of the room. On closer inspection they were all on top of a pile of spilled powder creamer. My husband had a mini melt down (as he was the crankiest of us all, having driven the 10 out of 12 hours). We were told that the inn was full to capacity and that we had to stay in that room, but to their credit, the staff did come quickly to spray the corners, but they couldn’t find the source or entry of the ants. By this time our room smelled of fumes and my children (3y.o and 1y.o.) and I had gone to another room to escape. When they said they couldn’t find the source, my husband really went berserk…he went to our car, got out the flashlight, moved all the furniture in the room and did an inch by inch inspection until he found where they were coming from. He didn’t just find one entry, but two!!! It may have been psychological, but we felt very itchy all night. A general feeling of dirtiness (btw, we found hair, that was not ours, on the sheets). Because we had booked the rooms through Expedia, we couldn’t get a discount and like I said before, because the inn was full to capacity, we couldn’t switch rooms. We did get a free breakfast for our whole party but I don’t think we will ever go back there, ever again.
reviews.title: Dirty, we found ants in our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Older property that is showing its age. 2 floors with no elevator. If you have large bags request a first floor room. Very close to the freeway and 10 minutes from downtown Bangor.
reviews.title: Nothing Special

reviews.text: Great place to stay there is 5 of us we all love it. Stay here 4-5 times a year. The kids love the pool and the mini golf next door. Usually quiet. They allow pets which is great as we bring out dog with us.
reviews.title: Good hotel

likes.disliked: — Food but you can eat other places

reviews.text: I stayed at the Ramada for one night, and it definitely wasn't terrible (I've stayed at worse hotels), but I'm pretty sure I will not stay there again. Nothing happened to make the stay bad, but I did find that the price was way too high ($120 + taxes for one person, basic room). The hotel was too basic to warrant such a high price, I also found the front desk staff to be a little unfriendly, the pool area wasn't the nices, and the location is okay but you can't really walk anywhere. I would say if you want to spend one or two nights in Bangor without having to pay a lot, you're better off paying half the price and staying at the Super 8 across the road.
reviews.title: Not bad, but very overpriced

reviews.text: We stayed here one night on our way through Bangor. I was very disappointed in the the quality of the room and cleanliness. We paid $125 CDN for this room through Expedia, which was the cheapest rate we could find at the time. For that price, I expected the room to be clean --- it wasn't. There was dust in all the corners and my son and my allerigies were bothering us all night due to dust. There was serious mold in the shower and the fixtures were coming out of the walls. Upon reading previous reviews, I assume that some of the hotel has been renovated and other parts have not been so ask for a renovated room. The hallways were also disgustingly dirty. I cannot believe this is a Ramada. The pool was o.k., and the kids did enjoy that.
reviews.title: Overpriced and in need of serious renovations...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been on a two week vacation and stayed in many hotels over the two weeks -- this one was by far the worst and we paid the more than some of the nicer hotels we stayed in! There are alot of hotels in the area -- I would look elseswhere or make sure you have a room in the renovated part of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Value Great Time

reviews.text: The lobby was very welcoming and the front desk person very friendly. The room seemed newly renovated and large. The Hotel is close by the airport, which was a big, plus for us. They provided a shuttle service to area attractions at no cost. The nightclub was a big surprise not thinking that we would find that atmosphere in Maine. The restaurant was excellent. Great Value, Great Food, Great Service.
reviews.title: Meh, very basic hotel

reviews.text: Nothing was bad about the Ramada, the room was fine for one night, don't expect anything other than a very basic room though. It provided a decent night's sleep and was very affordable. If you're looking for something more than that I'd suggest somewhere else.
reviews.title: One word - AVOID!

reviews.text: The restaurant attached had a nice breakfast and nice staff. The free wifi, printer and computer was also nice when I had to change some documents at the last minute for a meeting.
reviews.title: Not Bad; Better than Holiday Inn

description: The Bangor Ramada has just finished a new renovation. Part of that renovation includes a brand new swimming pool. Our pool is the newest and largest in the area. The hotel also provides high speed wireless, shuttle service and a full service restaurant.
